Description: Rim fragment of an Attic red-figured pottery cup, type C. Offset rim. Satyr moving stealthily right, hands outstretched; thyrsus tip at brreak to right, belonging to the lost maenad.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by University College Dublin, Department of Classics, Classical Museum. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
See CVA for the possible attribution of this piece to the Sotades Painter.
Bibliographic references: CVA UCD & UCC / Corpus Vasorum Antiquorum Ireland, Fascicule 1: University College Dublin, University College Cork (p. 41, no. 5, pl. 30, no. 5)
Vickers 1971 / Some Unpublished Sherds from Naukratis in Dublin (p. 118, no. 16, pl. 14.P)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GA.1451)
